entries.title: It turns out lots of us still want to use tablets at
entries.description: Tablets are continuing to sell in large numbers despite economic slowdown, new figures claim.

entries.title: Google expanding SafeSearch by blurring explicit images by default
entries.description: With the goal to create a safer internet, Google is also adding biometric authentication support to its Chrome browser.

entries.title: Healthcare firms are facing more attacks than ever before
entries.description: SailPoint report claims almost all hospitals were attacked over the past two years.

entries.title: The Last of Us fans warned of scam cyberattacks
entries.description: The series' success is being leveraged to deliver malware and steal banking data.

entries.title: Ransomware on the rise: how small and medium-sized businesses can achieve cyber resilience during turbulent times
entries.description: Awareness of cybercrimes is high, but preparedness is worryingly low. Everyone in the SMB community knows they should be doing something about cyber threats, but too few know what that is.

entries.title: Cloud spending slows, but market still saw a huge boost in 2022
entries.description: Global cloud market continues to grow, with three top brands still accounting for the majority.

entries.title: Microsoft ChatGPT event live: all the big A.I news for Bing, Windows and more
entries.description: We're live from Microsoft's campus where the company is unveiling progress on 'exciting projects'

entries.title: Sonos' next smart speaker could be a HomePod rival with Dolby Atmos
entries.description: Sonos has two (or three) new smart speakers launching this year that will use Dolby Atmos to take on Apple.

entries.title: Drop launches new Lord of the Rings mechanical keyboard worthy of Mordor
entries.description: Inspired by Sauron, the Black Speech keyboard seemingly keeps the same quality as the others of its line.

entries.title: Samsung reportedly preps fix for embarassing SSD issue
entries.description: Samsung plans to patch health errors with 990 Pro SSDs soon, but there could still be issues arising.

entries.title: Is your CPU struggling when gaming? Microsoft DirectStorage could come to the rescue
entries.description: The new tech has been tested with Forspoken, the first game to support it, with some compelling discoveries.

entries.title: Philips' new Hi-Res wireless headphones are ready for next-gen Bluetooth
entries.description: New Fidelio Premium models boast Bluetooth 5.3 and pack in new Auracast and LE audio features.

entries.title: How to watch the Nintendo Direct February showcase
entries.description: Nintendo Direct is back with a February 2023 presentation. Here's how to watch the gaming showcase live.

entries.title: Windows 11 transforms into a Chromebook killer thanks to Tiny11
entries.description: Tiny11 boots with an unbelievably low amount of system memory, but proceed with caution here...

entries.title: Stalkerware tycoon told to alert victims, pay major fine
entries.description: Developer of multiple spyware and stalkerware apps fined more than $400,000.

entries.title: Philips' new OLED TVs might actually dethrone LG as the best gaming TV
entries.description: Two new Philips models bring a great suite of gaming features, and possible class-leading HDR brightness for an OLED TV.

entries.title: Samsung’s stunning new 77-inch OLED TV is now available to pre-order
entries.description: First announced at CES 2023, Samsung’s new, larger OLED TV has arrived for pre-order in the US, and at a fairly substantial price.

entries.title: Encrypted message app Exclu shut down by police following criminal allegations
entries.description: Several arrests have been made, including alleged drug lords, as Exclu falls under scrutiny.

entries.title: OnePlus 11 launch live: all the latest on the flagship phone, OnePlus Tab and more
entries.description: The OnePlus 11 is expected to be launched outside of China today, alongside a OnePlus Tab and other treats. Join us for all of the live news.

entries.title: Google Chrome leaves Windows 7 and Windows 8 users in the lurch
entries.description: Google Chrome drops Windows 7 and Windows 8 – and so should you.

entries.title: Microsoft Authenticator is dropping Apple Watch support
entries.description: Apple Watch will no longer work with Microsoft Authenticator, but neither company is revealing too much on why.

entries.title: Watch this: Ridley Scott's impressive Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra short film
entries.description: Samsung has released a short film, directed by Ridley Scott, shot entirely using the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra.

entries.title: The iPhone 15 might work as a wireless charger for your Apple Watch
entries.description: Reverse wireless charging is reportedly still being worked on for the iPhone.

entries.title: This Windows security attack can take down your antivirus
entries.description: A new case of Windows Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver attacks was seen in the wild.

entries.title: 'Irresistibly energetic': first Ant-Man 3 reactions say it's 'Star Wars meets the MCU'
entries.description: The first reactions for Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania have arrived – and it sounds like an epic Marvel sci-fi movie.

entries.title: Google Chrome on iOS may be making some changes that will really make Apple mad
entries.description: Apple requires that browsers on its iOS platform use WebKit, but that hasn’t stopped Google from testing Blink anyway.

entries.title: Safer Internet Day: how to keep your kids safe online
entries.description: On the occasion of the 2023 Safer Internet Day, experts share some tips on how to make your children's online life safer.

entries.title: KEF's new Dolby Atmos speakers include an 'acoustic black hole' for better sound
entries.description: KEF’s impressive new R Series speakers bring audiophile-grade sound to your home – but they aren’t cheap.
